Pre-Game Insights: The T20I series between India and the West Indies has exceeded expectations with both teams playing entertaining cricket.
The series is now 2-1 in favor of the hosts, with Rovman Powell-led team winning the first two games and India rallying in the third to keep the series alive.
Key players in form for India include Ishan Kishan, Shubman Gill, and Hardik Pandya.
Key players in form for West Indies include Rovman Powell, Kyle Mayers, and Johnson Charles.
The temperature for the match will be around 30.3°C with humidity around 68%.
The pitch conditions favor slower bowlers more than rapid bowlers.
Teams will most likely prefer to bowl first.
Venue stats indicate that out of 14 matches, 11 were won by teams batting first and 2 by teams bowling first.
The highest total recorded at the venue is 245/6 and the lowest is 81/10.
India has won 18 out of 28 head-to-head matches against West Indies, with West Indies winning 9.

Probable playing XI for India includes Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Sanju Samson, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, Yuzvendra Chahal, and Mukesh Kumar.

Probable playing XI for West Indies includes Brandon King, Kyle Mayers, Johnson Charles, Nicholas Pooran, Rovman Powell, Shimron Hetmyer, Romario Shepherd, Jason Holder, Akeal Hosein, Alzarri Joseph, and Obed McCoy.
India is expected to win the fourth contest.
